title_sort: john m. rogers to walt whitman, 1 june 1871
title: John M. Rogers to Walt Whitman, 1 June 1871
text: June 1st 1871Dear Fathe[Father]It a long time cince[since] I heard from you and thinking you would like to hear from me thought I wright[write] you a line or two to see how you are geting[getting] along I am as well as can be I should like to hear from you very much I have got a good place and are doing well I like it very much I wilull[will] send you a card 480 Bway I supose[suppose] you will come on here soon to spend one or two months and then I shall see you It is very warm here yesterday we had a very hard thunder storm and it done a great deal of dammage[damage] along the North River & distroye[destroy] Houses and trees and fruit things is very quite[quiet] here except a murder now and then so now I will close with my lovegood bybye from you affecinate[affectionate] Son and FriendJohn M RogersTo my Dear Father write Soon. John M. Rogers to Walt Whitman, 1 June 1871
